title: What can be done about the risk of banknotes carrying the coronavirus? - Quora

response.answer_text: The same as everything else! Maintain good hygiene. Wash your hands regularly. Avoid touching your face. Wear gloves if you have to. News from scientists states that this current virus can survive for up to several hours outside of a human host. So if you are worried about items having it on them. Then when you return home, change your shoes, don’t just walk in wearing them like a lot of people do. Don’t wear your coat from outdoors indoors, Leave your cash in a safe place that children (if you have any) can’t reach it, and for emphasis…. WASH YOUR HANDS.

Paper currency is one of the main carriers of the virus. It thrives on the green ink. Here’s what everyone should do. Take all your paper currency and place it in a zip lock bag. Seal it securely. Then, put it in a large mailing envelope. Use a generous amount of packing tape to seal the flap. Take to a post office and mail it to me. My address will be furnished upon request. I am willing to do this for the greater good of Mankind.
